children.subject: Thank you for letting me know! :)
I don't think I can answer all of your questions, but good news: my friend late dropped a class this semester. She went below the unit cap, but she was told that it was fine.
when I took CS188 over the summer, it was webcast, so that may be an option if it is offered?
Maybe. I took 188 this summer and there was no webcast.

Thanks for the additional info! I guess it may change each summer depending on who teaches it? Unsure. I know there are some CS classes that do webcasts. Wondering if it's feasible to watch lectures from the semester for summer work.
Almost no summer class has webcasts. And doing 5 CS upperdivs is crazy, please make alternate plans..
Thank you so much for the insight! I really appreciate it :)

I was in a similar situation last fall and ended up dropping the class to have 11 units overall for the semester. I talked to L&S advisors before doing so though because I didn't want it to impact financial aid. I would definitely check with L&S first (email, drop-in hours?) just to be certain it's okay, especially if you receive financial aid. 

I can't answer about if it's feasible to take 5 upper-divs in the future, but personally I think it's best to prioritize your major plans since you may or may not decide to keep the minor as you take more classes. 

I really hope everything works out for you!

history.content:
Hi there,

It sounds like maybe you should use CalCentralto schedule an appointment with an Adviser. Your post contains a lot of different concerns for your peers to address via Piazza.


Best,

Nicole

children.subject:
Please don't prioritize your minor over your health! If you end up having to take more classes than you're comfortable with at a time, you could really negatively impact your GPA, health, and future. 

Some internships let your work remotely for a couple days a week - Cisco is one of them (I've heard). So maybe look into one of those if you'd like to take summer classes?

history.content: Unfortunately, I may drop a class that I believe I am legitimately failing. Just wanted to check, is late drop ok even if I go under the typical unit cap in L&S? Also, because I really wanted to do a certain minor, I may have to take five CS upperdivs in the future in one semester. Is this even possible even if I balance the easiest CS upperdivs with the most practical classes? There is more leeway for me if I take summer classes, but here's another predicament. I am worried about these classes conflicting with internship opportunities. Which CS classes have summer webcasts? Thank you so much in advance for any advice. I am very worried. :(
history.subject: Please Read. Much Need Advice :(
